titleNullable: Distance education Saudi Arabia during covid-19
subtitleNullable: sentiment analysis in Saudi Arabia about distance education during Covid-19
descriptionNullable:
Context
The data were collected from Twitter. About distance education in Saudi Arabia due to the Covid-19 pandemic. Arabic Tweets classified as positive or negative

Content
The data was obtained from Twitter. Distance education in Saudi Arabia as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic. Data were obtained from Sep 2 to Sep 17, 2020, which was the first two weeks of the new academic year. From four trending hashtags. Text Tweets in the Arabic language are categorized as positive or negative. The dataset contains 1675 records and 10 columns as following
Date: the date of the tweet

Time: the time of a tweet

Tweet: the text of a tweet

replies_count: the number of reply to the tweet

retweets_count: the number of retweet for the tweet

likes_count: the number of likes for the tweet

hashtags: number of hashtags used in the tweet

near: the name of the city where we collected

week: week of the tweet if it is in the first or second week

class: 0 for the reject, 1 for support the distance education

Source
Bador Alqahtani, Arwa Aldossary, Amnah Algamdi

Acknowledgements
We wouldn't be here without the help of others. If you owe any attributions or thanks, include them here along with any citations of past research.

Inspiration
Your data will be in front of the world's largest data science community. What questions do you want to see answered?
